The metric chosen to evaluate the classification accuracy of the hyperspectral imaging in screening loblolly pine seedlings for freeze tolerance was the geometric classification accuracy. This metric measures the overall accuracy of the classification model by considering both the sensitivity and specificity of the model.

According to the study, the geometric classification accuracies achieved by the hyperspectral imaging ranged from 75% to 78% before and within 10 days after the freeze event. However, the classification accuracy significantly improved to up to 96% for seedlings 41 days after the freeze event. instruction: Can hyperspectral imaging be considered a superior method compared to traditional methods for assessing freeze tolerance in loblolly pine seedlings, based on the findings of the study?
Output: Based on the findings of the study, hyperspectral imaging can be considered a superior method compared to traditional methods for assessing freeze tolerance in loblolly pine seedlings.
